The team's new head coach has no NFL head coaching experience but was the head coach at Boston College for four seasons.

title: Warriors Jimmy Butler Out for Season With Torn ACL
snippets: Jimmy Butler had to be helped from the Warriors' win against the Heat after landing awkwardly.

Forward Jimmy Butler suffered a season-ending torn right ACL in Monday’s game against the Miami Heat, according to ESPN’s Shams Charania. Butler was helped off the court at the 7:41 mark of the third quarter of a 135-112 victory against his former Miami team. The 36-year-old was hurt moments after catching a pass in the paint when he went down hard and awkwardly following a collision with the Heat’s Davion Mitchell — who was called for a foul. title: Blackhawks Defeat Jets 2 0 as Toews Receives Ovation in Chicago Return
snippets: Jonathan Toews returned to Chicago on Monday night with his hometown Jets, but it was clear that his first NHL city still counts him as one of its own.

Jonathan Toews took a deep breath, and then laughed and shook his head in disbelief as the standing ovation continued for four-plus minutes. “All right, all right,” he said before taking another lap in front of the cheering crowd.

CHICAGO — Spencer Knight made 32 saves, Jason Dickinson scored and the Chicago Blackhawks beat Jonathan Toews and the Winnipeg Jets 2-0 on Monday night. Connor Bedard added an empty-net goal in the third period as the Blackhawks stopped a three-game slide. It was Bedard’s first goal since returning from a right shoulder injury. Knight recorded his third shutout this season and the eighth of his career. Toews played his first game in Chicago since signing with Winnipeg on July 1. The 37-year-old centre played for the Blackhawks for 15 seasons, winning three Stanley Cup titles. Toews was...

title: At Least 39 Dead in High Speed Train Collision in Southern Spain
snippets: More than three dozen people were killed as two high-speed trains collided in southern Spain.
At least 39 people were killed in a high-speed train collision in southern Spain Sunday, police said. Efforts to recover the bodies are continuing, and the death toll is likely to rise.
A passenger train derailed near Córdoba and collided with a second train traveling in the opposite direction. The cause of the derailment is unknown.
A high-speed train smashed into another train after derailing in the southern province of Córdoba, officials said. The cause of the accident was not immediately clear.
